com.flowpowered.react.engine

Class Material

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.flowpowered.react.engine.Material

  • public class Material
extends Object
    Represents a material for a rigid body. The material has the restitution and friction coefficients. Altering these constants for a material will alter the constants for all bodies.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Material()
      Constructs a new rigid body material using ReactDefaults.DEFAULT_BOUNCINESS as the default bounciness and ReactDefaults.DEFAULT_FRICTION_COEFFICIENT as the default friction coefficient.
      Material(float bounciness, float frictionCoefficient)
      Constructs a new rigid body material from the provided bounciness and friction coefficient.
      Material(Material material)
      Copy constructor.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getBounciness

        public float getBounciness()
        Gets the bounciness.
        Returns:
        The bounciness

      • setBounciness

        public void setBounciness(float bounciness)
        Sets the bounciness. The bounciness should be a value between 0 and 1. The value 1 is used for a very bouncy body and zero is used for a body that is not bouncy at all.
        Parameters:
        bounciness - The bounciness

      • getFrictionCoefficient

        public float getFrictionCoefficient()
        Gets the friction coefficient.
        Returns:
        The friction

      • setFrictionCoefficient

        public void setFrictionCoefficient(float frictionCoefficient)
        Sets the friction coefficient. The friction coefficient has to be a positive value. The value zero is used for no friction at all.
        Parameters:
        frictionCoefficient - The coefficient to set

      • set

        public void set(Material material)
        Sets the material to be same as the provided one.
        Parameters:
        material - The material to assign

      • asUnmodifiableMaterial

        public static Material asUnmodifiableMaterial(Material material)
        Returns a new unmodifiable rigid body material. Unmodifiable means that the setBounciness(float) (float)} and setFrictionCoefficient(float) (float)} methods will throw an UnsupportedOperationException. This is does not use a wrapper class, and the original material is not linked to the one returned. That is, changes to the original material are not reflected by the returned material.
        Parameters:
        material - The material to make an unmodifiable copy of
        Returns:
        A new unmodifiable rigid body material.
